item.description: China has prohibited the importation of Spain poultry products due to high pathogenicity aviary outbreaks, suspending exports planned under an agreement in April to open the Chinese market to Spanish producers. In a statement, the China's General Customs Administration indicated that the decision aims to "prevent the spread of the disease and protect the safety and biosecurity of national cattle." Since August 7, direct and indirect imports of poultry and derivatives, including processed, are prohibited. The measures also provide for treatment, under customs supervision of all animal or agricultural waste that reach Chinese territory in any means of transport from Spain, as well as sanctions for those who violate the prohibitions. For now, a deadline for the end of the restrictions, similar to those imposed in May to Brazilian chicken imports, also due to aviary flu has not been settled in May. In April, the Spanish Minister of Agriculture, Fisheries and Food, Luis Plan, and China's deputy minister of customs, Lu Weihong, signed a new export protocol that would allow Spanish poultry producers to access the Asian country to diversify foreign sales. At the time, the Spanish ministry stressed that China "is a large buyer of bird meat and other products with reduced placement capacity in other markets."

item.title: Galaxy | Profits grow 19 percent in the first half
item.description:
In the first half of 2025, the Galaxy Entertainment group registered $ 5.24 billion of Hong Kong, an increase of 19.4 percent over the same period last year. In the note sent to the Hong Kong Stock Exchange, the company also announced the distribution of dividends from the end of October
In the first six months of 2025, the Galaxy Entertainment Group registered an annual profit rise of almost one fifth. According to a note released yesterday, the game concessionaire found $ 5.24 billion from Hong Kong (HKD) in the first half of this year, the equivalent of an annual increase of 19.4 percent. According to information given to the Hong Kong Stock Exchange, cited by the GGR Asia portal, the dealership will distribute dividends of 0.7 hkd per action from October 31st. The growth was also found at the level of net profits, which reached at the end of the first semester nearly 23.25 billion HKD, which is equivalent to an increase of 8.3 percent compared to the same period of 2024. Regarding the group's global results, the concessionaire reported a margin of profits before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization (EBITDA) of about 6.87 billion HKD in the first half of the year, which represented a 14.2 percent per year. The note sent by the group to the Hong Kong Stock Exchange also reveals that in the second quarter of 2025 the concessionaire had net profits of 12 billion HKD, more 10 percent than in the same period of 2024. The Ebitad between April and June this year registered an annual rise of 12 percent to a total of 3.6 billion HKD. Regarding net profits only of the group's casinos, the first semester was synonymous with an annual rise of 10.7 percent to an approximate total of 18.58 billion HKD. On the other hand, the group's non-game net revenues ascended nearly 3.17 billion HKD in the period under analysis, the equivalent of an annual increase of 2.5 percent. Effort proof "I am happy to announce the solid performance of the Macao market and the Galaxy Entertainment in the second quarter and first half of 2025. Despite the disruptions brought by tariffs, continuous economic slowdown and regional competition, Macau remained resilient." Galaxy's strong man highlighted the growth of all market segments, “in particular the premium mass segment”, as well as the group's financial health.

item.title: Islands Hospital | More than 100 operations to Falls in a month
item.description:
A medical team from the Conde de São Januário Hospital and Hospital Hospital performed more than a hundred surgeries to cataracts since mid -July. Three surgeons from both hospitals have worked daily in a process that, from preparation to discharge, lasts less than three hours
Since mid -July, more than a hundred people have been operated on the cataracts at Hospital das Ilhas, the institution yesterday indicated in a statement. Operations have been performed daily by a team of three surgeons from the Ophthalmology Department of Hospital das Ilhas and the Conde de São Januário Hospital Center, in coordination with health services. The new hospital center states that, to increase efficiency, the islands hospital adopted the surgery model implemented by the department of ophthalmology of Peking Union Medical College Hospital. According to the model used at the Chinese capital hospital center, on the day of surgery, approved patients who meet the requirements usually go through the whole process, from admission to pre-surgery preparations to hospital discharge in less than three hours. For patients who cannot leave the hospital on the same day due to special circumstances, the model allows them to change quickly and easily from the outpatient surgery program for hospitalization. Those responsible for the islands hospital to make sure that the flexibility of the personalized service model allows the discharge from the day after the operation, after an assessment of the surgeon. Authorities emphasize the convenience that the Beijing model gives to the elderly patients. Continue to grow In addition, it has been said that for a small number of more complex cataract surgeries, the islands hospital has experts from the Union Medical College and regularly invite expert teams with vast experience in cataract surgeries. As such, the institution emphasizes the importance of cooperation between Beijing and Macau to ensure the quality and safety of medical procedures performed at Hospital das Ilhas. It is also indicated that ophthalmological problems will continue to increase in complexity and frequency as the population of Macao ages. The medical institution is committed to continuing to optimize surgery services to cataracts, as well as the gradual integration of personnel from various departments, estimating that the number of patients ”that the hospital unit may meet will increase in the future.

item.title: Hengqin | Open contest for remodeling of Praça Dezhi
item.description:
The idea is to create a new city linked to the university, instead of the old plan for the replica of a German city. The public tender is open for the remodeling of Praça Dezhi, in Hengqin, with apartments next to the new neighborhood of Macau and the Campus of the University of Macau
A public tender is opened for the remodeling of Praça Dezhi, in the in -depth cooperation zone between Guangdong and Macao in Hengqin, in the space that has been designed to house the replica of a typically German city. Now, what is intended to be that Praça Dezhi will become a future university city, with apartments and other services, because it is so close to the new Macau neighborhood in Hengqin and also the campus of the University of Macao in this neighboring region. The contest, open until the 29th of this month, involves the transformation of a space with 13 buildings, in a total area of 49 thousand square meters, and the area intended for construction is 65 thousand square meters. In the new tenhi square, high buildings are expected for student activities, offices, apartments, a hotel and ten buildings for auxiliary teaching activities. The newspaper or world describes some details of the project, and it can be read that the specific location of Hengqin “brings strategic importance to this work, which means that cooperation between Macau and Hengqin has already entered a new stage in order to support Macau in a better integration in national development” in the country. Response to scarcity Still in the details of the project cited by the or world, it is described that the renewal of the Praça Dezhi also aims to respond to the scarcity of space in the masters. “The scarcity of land in Macao limits, in the long run, the expansion of higher education institutions and their academic update. The completion of this transient campus not only satisfies the needs of Macao higher education and research for a certain period, but also encourages a deeper integration of advantageous areas for universities, such as traditional Chinetic medicine and the field of microelectronics.” Thus, it is added, “in conjunction with the hengqin industries, through the 'Campus + Industrial Park' model contributes to Macau to form new production forces and reach a diverse [economic] development,” is quoted. Praça Dezhi was thought, before the pandemic, to be the German City Hengqin, the replica of a typical German city with 150,000 square meters where German and Chinese cultures would converge. According to an article from the 2020 South China Morning Post newspaper, the project intended to attract investments from the large bay zone, with US $ 229 million investment from TFG International, a company listed on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange. An International Center for Convention and Exhibitions would also be built, as well as hotels and offices. The sale of properties started in 2019, but was stagnant due to the pandemic years. In addition, there were several disputes and many owners could not receive the houses where they had invested the money. In the announcement of the new project, it is read that the work for Praça Dezhi continues to maintain “the European architectural characteristics”, highlighting the future characteristics of the university city in interior and outer spaces, designed for leisure zones and shows.

item.title: Caeal | Information Search reflects interest from voters
item.description:
The president of the Commission of Electoral Affairs of the Legislative Assembly said yesterday that in a week about 116,000 people consulted information about the polling place. Song Ioi Man considers that the volume of consultations demonstrates the electoral's interest in the electoral act
In the space of one week, the Commission of Electoral Affairs of the Legislative Assembly (Caeal) registered about 116,000 information on the vote, yesterday said the president of the body that organizes the suffrage of September 14. Song Ioi Man considers that the volume of consultations reflects the interest with which the population accompanies the work related to the electoral process. Last Tuesday, several means of consultation were launched for voters to learn about the voting assembly attributed through the Single Account application, an open line, the Caeal page and in self-service kiosks for public services. At a press conference on the way out of another body meeting, the judge also said that on Friday the distribution of public spaces that will be destined for election campaign activities. Thus is completed another step for the beginning of the campaign period, which starts on August 30 and will last 14 days. When asked what happens if a list conducts election campaign actions outside Macao and the established deadline, the president of Caeal stressed that the electoral law also applies outside Macao. According to the Chinese channel of Radio Macau, the official said he hoped the police authorities will have the means capable of dealing with the situation and overseeing activities outside the MSAR, namely through police cooperation mechanisms with abroad authorities. Act Guardians During the suffrage, while the ballot boxes are open, between 09h and 21h, each list can appoint two representatives (one staff and an alternate), to oversee the electoral process in each of the voting assemblies. The president of Caeal said that the lists may present the names of representatives between next Saturday and 25 August, so that they obtain an entity certificate, which should be lifted at the Caeal reception counter, in the public administration building, on Rua do Campo, until two days before election day. One of the requirements of these representatives is to vote at the voting assemblies they will oversee.

item.title: GARDEN House | Inaugurated “After Eastern Garden” with works by local and foreign artists
item.description:
Since yesterday, the Oriente Foundation welcomes another exhibition, integrated into the annual program of “Macao Art: Macao International Art Biennial”. It is “After Eastern Garden”, curated by Kathine Cheong, who welcomes Charlie Perez-Tlatechi, Elói Scarva, Ho Tzu Nyen, Jinjin Xu and Vividly, name of duo Jay Lee and Jay Lei
Since yesterday it is possible to visit at Casa Garden, headquarters of the Oriente Foundation (FO) in Macau, a new exhibition. It is “After Eastern Garden” [after the Eastern Garden ”, a collective show that can be seen until October 5th and is another initiative of“ Macao Art: International Art Biennial of Macao ”. With free admission, the curatorship of this project was in charge of Kathine Cheong, revealing works where “Macau is the anchor to navigate the city's multifaceted memories, reflecting on the interconnection between colonial history, commercial flows and ecological changes,” describes a press release about the event. The public will be able to see works by five groups of local and foreign artists, namely Charlie Perez-Tlatechi, Elói Scarva, Ho Tzu Nyen, Jinjin Xu and Vividly, name of the duo Jay Lee and Jay Lei. They all "transformed personal experiences into artistic creations in the form of files, sculptures, videos and sound installations." In "After Oriental Garden", we seek to "destabilize stereotyped metanarratives, allowing hidden voices to surface and" other invisible "to be present in space." In the Garden house there will be, therefore, the “convergence of different artists” in a “interdisciplinary” format. Multiple views The exhibition presents the work of Elói Scarva, a Portuguese artist from Macau and who also works as a journalist. Scarva presents the sculpture work “Capsules - Eco Chambers”, composed of “eight temporal capsules that confront the physical evidence of cultural exchanges”. Founder of the “Republic of Arts of Coloane” Association, Elói Scarva has been promoting initiatives linked to contemporary art in the territory. Another artist present in this show is Jinjin XU, whose art ways between Macau, Shanghai and New York. This responds to the appeal launched by the show with the work "poetic of the witness". The artist was recognized by the Chinese edition of Forbes as "one of the 100 most influential Chinese personalities." Also noteworthy is for Singapore artist Ho Tzu Nyen, who presents the video “O of Opium”, where the historical impact of opium trade in the Asian region is reexamined. His most recent works address historical transformations and future visions of Asia. Casa Garden also welcomes the work of emerging New York artist Charlie Perez-Tlatechi, who displays new and old works, which uses "materials and images as fables to reflect on hidden stories in the process of globalization." Also present is the duo who adopted the name Vividly, and has been nominated four times for the Hong Kong Theater Libre awards. In Macau, the pair of artists presents "a new commissioned project on the journey of cities, memory and objects", entitled "Pulse of Things: A Memory under the missing stream." This show is divided into three parts, namely “wandering echoes”, “East Journey” and “Palimpseste da Fénix”. The works arranged in the "wandering echoes" can be seen right on the stairs of Casa Garden, followed "trip to the East" with "three doors that head [the visitors] to different narrative spaces." In the final phase, "Palimpseste da Phenix", allows for a prolongation of all narratives counted above, "intertwining historical memory and contemporary experience, transforming them into recreation, establishing a space for open thinking." In addition to the show itself, during the exposure period there will be parallel activities such as the Sonoro Concert “In the Garden-Flow of the Moon”, the research sharing “Tour Stories” by the Vividly Collective; The conversation of artists “Borders: Research Methods in Interdisciplinary Projects”, the Botany Workshop “Symbiotic Ramos: The Secret Language of Plants in Macao” and also educational workshops for secondary and university students.

item.title: NVIDIA | Beijing Dead Slips Use of Chips H20
item.description: Chinese authorities have recommended in recent weeks to local companies that avoid using H20 processors from US manufacturer Nvidia, especially in projects linked to government agencies or national security, Bloomberg agency said yesterday. According to Bloomberg, warnings sent to several companies included, in some cases, questions about the reasons to choose the H20 over national alternatives, the need for this choice and any security problems detected on the devices. The recommendation would also cover US Artificial Intelligence Accelerators (AI) AMD. The guidance coincides with recent information released by Chinese organisms and state agencies that question the safety and reliability of the H20, a model designed by Nvidia for the Chinese market with specifications lower than the most advanced versions, in accordance with the restrictions imposed by Washington. At the end of July, the Chinese Internet regulator (CAC) called on Nvidia to clarify alleged safety risks on chips and have evidence that it does not contain “rear doors”, an accusation that the company has rejected. On Monday, Nvidia again denying that H20 integrates access or remote control functions, in response to comments released on a social network account associated with state television CCTV, which cited experts that it would be technically possible to incorporate screening capabilities, location or remote shutdown in this type of processors.

item.title: Crime | Uses knife to extort money and is arrested
item.description: A Chinese interior citizen was arrested after threatening a casino player, also from the interior of China, with a table knife to transfer 69,000 Renminbis. According to the Chinese channel of Radio Macau, the woman met the man when they were both playing in a casino in the early hours of Tuesday, having convinced the player to go to her room. There, the man carried out a robbery, cutting the woman's wrist with the knife, asking him to transfer the money, and then asked him to take off his clothes. It was then that the man photographed the naked woman, demanding her not to call the police. Only yesterday morning the Judiciary Police (PJ) picked up the man in the Cotai zone, in possession of game sheets and notes with a total value of $ 7.5 thousand from Hong Kong. The case has already been referred to the Public Prosecution Service, running the risk of being accused of theft crimes, by stopping a weapon without justification and other instruments, for engraving and photographing illicitly and also for the wanton of private life, in this case against women.

item.title: CCCM | Fusion with Foundation for Science and Technology creates new agency
item.description:
Operating since 1999, the Macau Scientific and Cultural Center will merge with the Foundation for Science and Technology and the National Innovation Agency, creating a new institution. The practical consequences for the CCCM that aims to promote studies on Macao, China and Asia in Portugal are unknown. The president of the center says it is early to make comments
It is not known whether it will maintain its name, the number of scholarships for studies on China, Macao and Asia, or whether to change staff, but what is certain is that the Macao Scientific and Cultural Center (CCCM) will merge with the Foundation for Science and Technology (FCT) and the National Innovation Agency. Of these three entities will be born the new agency for research and innovation. The process is linked to the desire to reform the Ministry of Education, Science and Technology by the Portuguese government led by Luís Montenegro, and the changes were announced on Thursday. However, there is still no great information about the consequences of this merger to the CCCM. At HM, Carmen Amado Mendes, its president, chose to refer to clarification for the future operation of the center, considering that it is "premature" to give answers about something "that is not yet defined." On Thursday, Minister Fernando Alexandre announced the reform of the Ministry of Education, Science and Innovation with the extinction of several entities, including FCT that has been the main financier of PhD and other research projects in Portugal. The reform of the ministry was approved by the Council of Ministers and, at a press conference at the end of the meeting, Fernando Alexandre justified the restructuring by describing his ministry as an “anacronic structure”, with fragmented organizations, disintegrated information systems and disarticulated governance. With 18 entities and 27 higher leaders between the services of the non -higher education system and higher education, science and innovation, the ministry will have only seven entities and 27 higher leaders, with the integration of extinguished entities into new entities. Regarding the extinction of the FCT, the minister assured that the financing of science will be preserved, with funding for four years that guarantees stability, predictability and “the protection of the financing of the most basic fundamental investigation”. “When we started thinking about this reform, we do it with a vision: to ensure equal opportunities to access quality education,” said Fernando Alexandre, also underlining the reinforcement of the education system. Marcelo can veto The extinction of FCT has generated some less good reactions in Portugal because it fears a reduction in investment in science and research. Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, president of the Portuguese Republic, said he had “the sensation” that the foundation was replaced “with an agency in which he was integrated, and had other functions beyond those of FCT.” Marcelo acknowledged that the Foundation was a “very old structure” and that “it had many aspects that deserved to be rethought”, but said: “Just seeing what the new agency will do can I answer if this extinction is a good or bad idea.” As for the eventual 'green light' from Belém, Marcelo said that if he thinks this extinction is "good", promulgates the diploma "without anguish." "If you have doubts about a point that is this diploma that is very important I ask the government to rethink. It has happened. I may not veto soon. If the government insists, I can come to veto, if it is until the end of my mandate," he also admitted. A history of the transition The CCCM was born in 1995 during the administration of Vasco Rocha Vieira, the last Portuguese governor of Macao, intending to be “a place of excellence for the dissemination of Macau, its history, its culture and its economy”, reads in the memories of Rocha Vieira, “to all the ports I arrived”. This entity, operating in the Alcântara area, in Lisbon, was inaugurated in November 1999 by the then President of the Republic, Jorge Sampaio, and had as first president Alexandra Costa Gomes. On the CCCM website it is read that the institution is endowed with administrative autonomy and its own heritage, being a public institute integrated in the indirect administration of the state and under the tutelage of the Ministry of Education, Science and Innovation. In the objective booklet, it is read that the CCCM “has as its mission to produce, promote and disseminate knowledge about Macao as a platform between Portugal and the Popular Republic of China, as well as between Europe and Asia”, also presenting itself as “a space dedicated to the study and teaching of Chinese language, culture and history”. The center has also been established as "a center for scientific research and continuous and advanced training on the relations between Portugal and China, as well as between Europe and Asia." After the long presidency of Luís Filipe Barreto, academic at the University of Lisbon, the CCCM began to be chaired, from February 2020, by Carmen Amado Mendes. The leader recently saw her service committee renewed by 2030. A few months after taking office as president, Carmen Amado Mendes presented, on September 18, 2020, the new “Strategic Development Plan of the Macau Scientific and Cultural Center 2020-2030”. Since then, the CCCM has awarded dozens of doctoral scholarships for the studies of Macao, China and Asia, and the “Spring Conferences”, which bring together academic performances around the same themes every year. Also noteworthy that the CCCM opened, in December last year, the “Gallery of Governors”, with 41 paintings of the former Portuguese governors of Macao. A new building that houses the file and library was also inaugurated. This plan sets objectives by 2030, "the reinforcement of scientific and cultural cooperation in the domain of past understanding, present and future trends of relations between Europe and Asia." With regard to archives, it is intended to “modernize and dynamization within a network of documentation centers and international reference file on euro-seatic themes, with emphasis on the various files in Lisbon, but also in Portugal and Europe”. Given that CCCM houses, in its facilities, the Macao Museum, the board points to the “insertion and appreciation in the museum network at the level of Lisbon and National”. The central idea of the plan was to develop, by 2030, “CCCM facilities as a pole of streamlining scientific, cultural and economic relations between Portugal and China, including the installation of entities such as the Luso-Chinese Chamber of Commerce and Industry, the Erasmus+Youth Entrepreneurs Association, as well as research nuclei in eurical studies”. It remains to be seen if, with the merger, all these initiatives will continue their initial course.

item.title: Tariffs: Seven agreements since Trump arrived at the White House
item.description:
The United States have reached seven bilateral trade agreements since Donald Trump returned to the White House in January and the latest, signed on Sunday with the European Union (EU), is the largest in terms of business volume. In addition to the EU agreement, the US government has agreed new commercial terms with the United Kingdom, China, Vietnam, Japan, Philippines and Indonesia, while negotiations continue with dozens from other countries, US authorities. Here is the data from the list of the seven bilateral trade agreements that Trump was able to obtain since January, when he returned to the White House for a second presidential term. +++ United Kingdom +++ Signed on May 8, it was the first bilateral agreement signed by Trump since the US government announced a new tariff plan. This agreement establishes the reduction of tariffs on British cars from 25% to 10% - up to 100,000 vehicles per year - and the elimination of steel and aluminum tariffs; Reciprocal permissions for export of beef and agricultural products, as well as reduction of non -tariff barriers and simplification of customs procedures. +++ China +++ On June 26, after reciprocal threats of tariffs up to 115%, the United States and China have reached an agreement of principle that is still being developed. Although it keeps high rates-55% for exporting certain Chinese products to the United States-facilitates the export of rare land in China, eliminates mutual retaliation measures and softens controls on Chinese products to the US market. +++ Vietnam +++ The US and Vietnam agreed on July 2 to increase the vietnamese exports to the US to 20% (with a 40% rate on the products suspected of being Chinese origin). Trump's previous threat was to establish tariffs in the 46%.
++ Japan ++ Japan agrees with a 15% rate on all its exports to the United States compared to the 25% rate with which Trump had threatened. The country was committed to investing $ 550 billion (about 470 billion euros) in the US and opening its markets to sectors such as car, rice and agricultural products. ++ Philippines ++ The US now imposing a 19% rate on Philippine products, less a percentage point than the 20% that had threatened, in exchange for the exemption of tariffs on US products that enter the Philippines. The announcement was made on July 22, after the visit of Filipino President Ferdinand Marcos Jr., to the White House. ++ Indonesia ++ On the same date, July 22, and with almost identical content, Trump's agreement with Indonesia establishes 19% rates on exports to the United States and, in parallel, includes aircraft purchase commitments, US agricultural and energy products. ++ European Union ++ On Sunday, July 27, the trade agreement between the United States and the EU was announced, which states that most European exports will be subject to 15% fees - Trump had threatened with 30% - but included tariff exemptions for certain products. In the agreement, the EU is committed to buying $ 750 billion (about 650 billion euros) in the United States, investing $ 600 billion (about 510 billion euros) in the country and increasing its US military equipment purchases.

item.title: Australia | Great Coral Barrier has been declining since there is a record
item.description: The Great Barrier of Choir, with 2,300 kilometers long, off the Australian East, has been suffering the largest coral decline since registrations began in 1986, a yesterday report published. The Australian Institute of Marine Sciences, of the government, documented the condition of 124 reefs between August 2024 and May 2025 to determine the widespread coral lanchament in the three sections of the Greater Barrier. The impact is higher in the northern areas (Cape York to Cooktown), with a 24.8 percent decline compared to the 2024, and southern levels (proserpine to gladstone), with 30.6 percent, representing these two values “the largest annual decline in coral cover” in 39 years. In the central region (cooktown to proserpine), the decline recorded is 13.9 percent compared to last year. The last episode of bleaching on site, declared UNESCO's World Heritage Site, has a "high to extreme" prevalence in all three areas, scientists find in the report. “Individual reefs registered a decline of corals of up to 70.8 percent” near Lizard Island in the North Zone, it refers to the study. The death of the corals, manifested by its bleaching, is caused by the impact of water heating - temperatures were recorded one to 2.5 degrees above average during the southern summer of 2025 - associated with the climate crisis. The large coral barrier “experienced unprecedented levels of thermal stress, resulting in the larger and more severe laundering that there is registration to date,” it reads in the document, in reference to the phenomenon that occurred in 2024 and continued during the first months of this year. The Australian agency warns that the habitat can reach “a point of non -return”, where the choir cannot quickly recover sufficiently between catastrophic events.

item.title: Hong Kong | Economic Report Highlights Startup “Historical Record”
item.description:
"Hong Kong's startups are on the rise." This is how the executive in the neighboring region describes the business environment in the region, where they were created in 2024 about 4,700 startups, plus 10 percent of 2023. In the "Report of Hong Kong's Business Environment 2025" it is read that the territory is far from losing economic competitiveness
The Hong Kong government released last July 30 the latest report on the neighboring region's economic scene. And one of the highlights is given to the scenario of growth of entrepreneurship. In the “Report of Hong Kong's Business Environment 2025” [Hong Kong 2025 Business Environment Report] it is noteworthy that “Startups in Hong Kong are on the rise”, given that last year there were “about 4,700 startups in the city, a historic record and an increase of 10 percent from the previous year”. The document explains that "more than a quarter of these startups has founders from outside Hong Kong," it is companies that operate in a "broad spectrum of sectors, including Fintech [High Technology], Electronic Trade and Information, Informatics and Technology", having hired more than 17,000 people. This number of human resources also represents an increase of seven percent compared to 2023. "All this is proof of Hong Kong's strong appeal for startup entrepreneurs," the authorities highlight. But it is not only startups that record growth, with the report to point out that the current government, led by executive head John Lee, "achieved remarkable results in attracting companies, investments and talents." "For example, in 2024, the number of companies in Hong Kong with headquarters outside the territory increased significantly by about 10 percent, reaching almost 10,000." The “Office for the attraction of strategic companies, created more than two years ago, attracted 84 strategic companies to establish or expand their business in Hong Kong, including companies with market capitalization or valuation of over $ 10 billion, involving cutting -edge technology”, it is added. The report also points out that between January 2023 and the first half of this year, Invest Hong Kong, linked to the Raehk government's direct foreign investment department, "helped over 1300 foreign and continent companies establishing or expanding their business in Hong Kong, bringing investments of over $ 160 billion." Still with regard to Invest Hong Kong, the entity helped "539 companies from the continent or foreign to establish or expand their business in Hong Kong, which represents an annual growth of over 40 percent." At the end of June this year, Hong Kong had 1.5 million local companies, while the total number of companies not registered in Hong Kong reached 15 509. "Both numbers represent historical records," it reads, and for the government of the neighboring territory the data "demonstrate the great confidence that continent and abroad companies have in the future of Hong Kong." Given that Hong Kong also has a talent capture program, the Hong Kong Talent Engage, reads in the report that by June this year "were received about 500,000 candidates in the shelter of various talent admission programs, of which about 330,000 were approved." Of these numbers, Hong Kong actually arrived to work 220,000 qualified frames. Good scholarship scenario Quoted on an official press release, a government spokesman stated that "in a complex and volatile external environment, Hong Kong is undergoing a phase of economic update and transformation, but there are more opportunities than challenges." Given that the territory has always positioned itself as a strong financial market worldwide, this scenario seems to have recorded a recovery in recent years. “This year Hong Kong's financial market performance has been constantly improving. The Hang SENG Index has a 18 percent increase last year and an increase of more than 25 percent this year so far. The average daily business volume in the first half of the year was about $ 240 billion, with an increase of about 120 percent.” Authorities highlight the maintenance of the economic competitiveness of the territory, pointing out that "over the years Hong Kong has been constantly classified as a global leader in economic freedom and competitiveness." Attention to the trade war In conclusion, Raehk's government clarifies that territory seems to maintain economic stability in times of constant commercial conflicts, with Donald Trump threatening and imposing tariffs on a number of countries. “As volatile and turbulent as the world may be, we remain firmly committed to the rules -based multilateral commercial system, with the WTO [World Trade Organization] as a nucleus, while actively participating and supporting regional economic cooperation.” The “numerous advantages of Hong Kong” are referred to, with its “highly internationalized business environment, a flexible and solid financial system, a simple and secure tax regime with low tax rates and a robust and independent legal system”. However, in the document it is also stressed that the “tariff war caused a global reallocation of capital”, and Hong Kong wants to bet on the attraction of “foreign companies and capital” to the region. The report also tells that "international organizations and foreign trade chambers in Hong Kong are confident in the future perspectives" of the territory, and that for the authorities "there is no reason to worry about some excessively pessimistic feelings." "In fact, the Raehk government is creating a new momentum and expanding the ability to support Hong Kong's economic growth, thus increasing its overall competitiveness and achieving high quality development," is still added. The executive spokesman also established a parallelism between good economic situation and political stability. "In recent years, the implementation of the National Security Law has restored a stable social environment in Hong Kong. This not only protected the rights and freedoms of the general public, but also made Hong Kong a safe haven to attract international capital and investment," he concluded. The report was presented by the secretary for Hong Kong finances, Paul Chan.

item.title: Rain | HK alerts and more than 80,000 residents of Beijing removed from home
item.description:
China and Hong Kong have faced periods of heavy rainfall in recent days that have forced extra care and residents' travel. In the Chinese capital 82,000 people had to leave their homes, while in Hong Kong streets and a hospital suffered floods and some subway stations were closed
Strong rains continue not to give respite, not only in Macau (see page 7), but in Hong Kong and in the interior of the country. In the case of China, Beijing authorities moved more than 82,000 people from home due to torrential rain, a week after deadly floods that led those responsible for recognizing failures in the response, the official news agency Xinhua said yesterday. Thus, tens of thousands of residents were removed from the most affected areas by rain until 9 pm on Monday, local time, according to the Municipal Flood Response Center. The center warned of the high risk of floods in the districts of Miyun (northwest), Fangshan (southwest), lied (west) and Huairou (north). The Chinese capital kept in force the red alert-the highest-until yesterday morning, before predictions of heavy rainfall between Monday to noon and the morning of Tuesday. Last week, these same rural districts north of Beijing were the most affected by the weather that caused 44 dead and nine missing, according to official data. Most of the deadly victims were registered in a home of elderly in Miyun. New measures in agriculture The severity of the catastrophe led municipal authorities to recognize “gaps” in the preparation of emergency services. Natural disasters are frequent in China during summer, with some regions subject to torrential rainfall and others to severe droughts. However, the Chinese authorities have reinforced the device to respond to the adverse effects of intense rainfall and heat waves on agricultural crops in various regions of the country, at a crucial time for autumn harvesting. Since the beginning of the rainy season, east and northern China zones have recorded episodes of extreme precipitation, while provinces such as Henan (center) and Anhui (East) face prolonged periods of drought and high temperatures. This combination of meteorological phenomena represents a challenge for farmers, especially when about two months left to harvest the main autumn cereals, the official news agency Xinhua yesterday pointed out. In the province of Shaanxi (Center), where precipitation recently exceeded 100 millimeters in less than 24 hours, local authorities adopted preventive measures such as channel cleaning and reinforcement of dikes, which allowed to protect most of the cultivated lands. However, Henan agricultural cooperatives affected by drought opted for gout watering systems and localized application of fertilizers to conserve moisture and minimize losses. Authorities have given priority to the rehabilitation of water infrastructure and the dissemination of efficient water management techniques in the absence of precipitation in some areas. The autumn campaign represents a fundamental component of China's annual cereal production. In a statement issued yesterday, the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Affairs warned that weather conditions in the coming weeks will be determining and appealed to "all efforts to protect the harvest and give strong support to the country's food security." Chinese President Xi Jinping said in 2023 that, although “1,400 million Chinese eat well” currently, “the food issue should not be careless”, stressing that the supply of food “is not an insignificant issue”. China has less than nine percent of the planet's aurable land, although it represents about 18 percent of the world's population. In the last summers, weather disasters have caused significant damage in the country: the 2023 scirred months were marked by flooding in Beijing, which caused more than 30 dead, while by 2022 several extreme and dried heat waves hit the center and east of China. Hong Kong on Alert With regard to the panorama of heavy rains in neighboring territory, they have not given respite either. According to public broadcaster RTHK, some hong Kong stations were closed yesterday due to the risk of flooding, given that the Hong Kong Observatory kept the black signal of storm [Black Rainestorm Warning Signal] until around 17 hours. Winds of about 110 kilometers per hour were recorded in some areas of the territory, and thunderstorms were also registered. The rthk channel also reveals that more than 10,800 lightnings were counted in the territory between midnight and 10 am yesterday, half of them occurred on Lantau Island. Until 11 am yesterday, the authorities responsible for the drainage systems recorded 21 episodes of flooding, and 180 emergency responses were made in 240 different locations. Highlight for the occurrence of an episode at Queen Mary Hospital this Tuesday, namely “on some roads” hospital access in Pok Fu Lam, and patients were displaced by firefighters to Ruttonjee Hospital in the Wanchai area. In some zones of the hospital the water reached the knees, and sand bags were placed to stop the flow of the rains. At about 11 am yesterday this scenario was resolved, with the normal one returning to the Queen Mary Hospital near noon. The rains also led to the large increase in water level in the Lower Shing Mun reservoir in the Sha Tin area, which led to the notification of nearby housing complexes, such as Mei Lam Estate, May Shing Court, Mei Chung Court and Granville Garden. Despite the heavy rains, some people went to work normally doing alternative routes. This was the case of Mak, a woman who, to the RTHK channel, said she had to make a deviation to get to the office. “I couldn't go straight to there and had to make a longer route. The metro [mtr] made some warnings [about the storm and closures], but I would like them to do them in the carriages as well, because I only realized that access was closed when I got to the exit,” he described. The sun Information provided by the Hong Kong Observatory speaks of the passage of an active "southwest monsoon and high altitude disturbances that are bringing heavy rainfall and violent thunderstorms to the southern coast of China and the northern part of the southern China Sea." Yesterday the highest daily precipitation record was broken to August since 1884, upon registered, until 14h, 355.7 millimeters of precipitation at the Observatory's headquarters. For today time should stay unstable in Hong Kong, with “heavy rains at the beginning” of the day. However, these "should gradually decrease" tomorrow, expected "a lot of heat with sunny periods in the next two days." Also the Meteorological and Geophysical Services (SMG) leave a heavy rain alert to this day with “frequent, sometimes intense, thunderstorm”. The sun is expected to start appearing at the MSAR from tomorrow, still with some clouds, extending this weather scenario until next Monday. Temperatures should reach 33 degrees.

item.title: USJ | Researchers discover a new species of bacteria in Portugal
item.description:
A team of local university researchers identified a new species of bacteria in the Salinas of Rio Maior, Portugal. The type of discovered organism, which lives in extreme environments, widens the limits of biological knowledge and may have implications in areas such as biomedicine, pharmacy or even spatial exploration
There is news in the field of microbiology thanks to the latest discovery of a team of researchers linked to the University of São José (USJ), led by André Antunes, interim director of the Institute of Sciences and Environment of the same educational institution. It is the discovery of a new species of bacteria from 12 samples collected in the Salinas of Rio Maior, in Portugal, which led to the establishment of the new species “Fodinibius alkaliphilus”. The species of bacteria previously known as “Alifodinibius salipaludis” for “Fodinibius salipaludis” was also reclassified. The conclusions appear in the article “Fodinibius alkaliphilus sp. Nov., Moderately halophilic and alkaliphilic bacterium isolated from an Inland Saltern in central and reclassification of aliifodinibius salipaludi as fodinibius salipalis sp. SYSTEMATIC AND EVOLUTIONARY MICROBIOLOGY. The scientific journal is a publication “reference for new macrobial data”, being the official publication of the International Procaryotes Systematic Committee and the Applied Bacteriology and Microbiology Division of the International Union of Microbiological Societies, describes a USJ note. In addition to André Antunes, the authors team includes researchers from the University of Science and Technology of Macau, coordinated by Marta Filipa Simões; Researchers at the University of Minho and Seville University. According to the same USJ note, "the new [bacteria] species grows better in salinities about four times higher than those of seawater and also prefers alkaline conditions, combining the ability to grow in different extreme environmental conditions." The importance of this type of studies, including analyzes to “such extreme environments”, is “future applications in a wide range of fields, including biomedical and pharmaceutical, but also extends to the discovery of new useful materials and the provision of useful information for future space exploration”. The same team of investigators is not stopped, as "other samples of these places are currently being investigated and new publications describing other new species are expected in the coming months." “This publication highlights the strengths of Macao in articulation with partners from Portuguese and Spanish -speaking countries, as well as its growing importance in the fields of biodiversity and biotechnology,” is still described. The Power of Salinas The researchers explain that "the species Aliifodinibius Salipaludis has been described, but their name has not yet been validly published." In field work the team isolated these species from “hypersaline environments, including saline, salt mines and saline soils”. Prior to the field work itself, the team conducted “an investigation to the microbial diversity of hypersaline environments in downtown Portugal”, with samples in the Rio Maior zone in July 2019, 12 genera bacteria were isolated from the Rio Maior salines. Located in the central area of Portugal, in these Salinas there is the “brine, which is about seven times more salty than seawater”, being “pumping from a well and generated by the crossing of a local underground course with an extensive salt deposit”. The article also gives a historical context of this location. "Although they were first referred to in twelfth-century documents, these places are believed to have been linked to salt extraction from prehistoric times. They offer a single scenario, as they are the only interior saline in Portugal and the only ones in full functioning throughout Europe." Thus, the study in question “was part of a bioprospecting campaign centered on this place”, resulting in “the isolation of a bacterial strain (N2T) and the discovery of a new putative species within the genus Fodinibius”. In this work is determined “the taxonomic position of this new isolated based on the phenotypic, chemotaxonos and molecular properties”, is described. Importance for Science At HM, André Antunes explained that this discovery is, first of all, interesting to the scientific community, by bringing “additional information” and constituting a discovery “about the biodiversity that exists on our planet, more concretely at the macrobial level”. "So far, we have been able [general scientific community] to study less than 1 percent of all microbes species on the planet. In over 99 percent we have no idea what they are, what they do and what their abilities, or what impact on the environment and our lives," he explained. The researcher also said that "the microbes that come from extreme environments, and above all from environments with a lot of salt, which is the case of this species we now discover, are very interesting for a large range of biotechnology applications." "We can include things like the medical area, biomedicine, the production of new pharmaceutical compounds or the production of new biomaterials, such as bioplastics," said André Antunes. The academic even talks about applications in “more exotic areas, which are now beginning to have a little more visibility, such as the potential application in construction, the production of more sustainable cements or concrete structures that have the self -repair capacity”. This discovery also has some impact "for space exploration, more specifically to better understand what the limits of life are and where to seek life outside our planet." It is also included "very important implications for missions that are exploring Mars, namely as to the type of environments where it may be feasible to find past signs of life or present or other parts of the solar system." A job that continues The investigation is not for the Salinas of Rio Maior, and the team led by André Antunes last year, an expedition to Antarctica. “There are antarctic samples that we are currently studying and we have samples taken from the red sea bottom, where salt concentration is also quite high.” Therefore, the saga of discovering new bacteria and potential reclassifications in those that already exist. André Antunes says that the discovery of a new species of microbes "is quite important to science, not only for the perspective of science at the basic level, but because we can have a better perspective of diversity we have on the planet." “As we study extreme environments we can have additional information about what the limits of life are and how life adapts to extreme conditions.” Thus, André Antunes advocates investment in science so that there is later “an associated practical component, so it is not always easy to convince the financing entities”, as to this point. item.title: Hengqin | Open contest for remodeling of Praça Dezhi
item.description:
The idea is to create a new city linked to the university, instead of the old plan for the replica of a German city. The public tender is open for the remodeling of Praça Dezhi, in Hengqin, with apartments next to the new neighborhood of Macau and the Campus of the University of Macau
A public tender is opened for the remodeling of Praça Dezhi, in the in -depth cooperation zone between Guangdong and Macao in Hengqin, in the space that has been designed to house the replica of a typically German city. Now, what is intended to be that Praça Dezhi will become a future university city, with apartments and other services, because it is so close to the new Macau neighborhood in Hengqin and also the campus of the University of Macao in this neighboring region. The contest, open until the 29th of this month, involves the transformation of a space with 13 buildings, in a total area of 49 thousand square meters, and the area intended for construction is 65 thousand square meters. In the new tenhi square, high buildings are expected for student activities, offices, apartments, a hotel and ten buildings for auxiliary teaching activities. The newspaper or world describes some details of the project, and it can be read that the specific location of Hengqin “brings strategic importance to this work, which means that cooperation between Macau and Hengqin has already entered a new stage in order to support Macau in a better integration in national development” in the country. Response to scarcity Still in the details of the project cited by the or world, it is described that the renewal of the Praça Dezhi also aims to respond to the scarcity of space in the masters. “The scarcity of land in Macao limits, in the long run, the expansion of higher education institutions and their academic update. The completion of this transient campus not only satisfies the needs of Macao higher education and research for a certain period, but also encourages a deeper integration of advantageous areas for universities, such as traditional Chinetic medicine and the field of microelectronics.” Thus, it is added, “in conjunction with the hengqin industries, through the 'Campus + Industrial Park' model contributes to Macau to form new production forces and reach a diverse [economic] development,” is quoted. Praça Dezhi was thought, before the pandemic, to be the German City Hengqin, the replica of a typical German city with 150,000 square meters where German and Chinese cultures would converge. According to an article from the 2020 South China Morning Post newspaper, the project intended to attract investments from the large bay zone, with US $ 229 million investment from TFG International, a company listed on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange. An International Center for Convention and Exhibitions would also be built, as well as hotels and offices. The sale of properties started in 2019, but was stagnant due to the pandemic years. In addition, there were several disputes and many owners could not receive the houses where they had invested the money. In the announcement of the new project, it is read that the work for Praça Dezhi continues to maintain “the European architectural characteristics”, highlighting the future characteristics of the university city in interior and outer spaces, designed for leisure zones and shows.

item.description:

In the space of one week, the Commission of Electoral Affairs of the Legislative Assembly (Caeal) registered about 116,000 information on the vote, yesterday said the president of the body that organizes the suffrage of September 14. Song Ioi Man considers that the volume of consultations reflects the interest with which the population accompanies the work related to the electoral process. Last Tuesday, several means of consultation were launched for voters to learn about the voting assembly attributed through the Single Account application, an open line, the Caeal page and in self-service kiosks for public services. At a press conference on the way out of another body meeting, the judge also said that on Friday the distribution of public spaces that will be destined for election campaign activities. Thus is completed another step for the beginning of the campaign period, which starts on August 30 and will last 14 days. When asked what happens if a list conducts election campaign actions outside Macao and the established deadline, the president of Caeal stressed that the electoral law also applies outside Macao. According to the Chinese channel of Radio Macau, the official said he hoped the police authorities will have the means capable of dealing with the situation and overseeing activities outside the MSAR, namely through police cooperation mechanisms with abroad authorities. Act Guardians During the suffrage, while the ballot boxes are open, between 09h and 21h, each list can appoint two representatives (one staff and an alternate), to oversee the electoral process in each of the voting assemblies. The president of Caeal said that the lists may present the names of representatives between next Saturday and 25 August, so that they obtain an entity certificate, which should be lifted at the Caeal reception counter, in the public administration building, on Rua do Campo, until two days before election day. item.title: Food Waste | Pereira Coutinho suggests combat plan
item.description:
José Pereira Coutinho wants the government to combat food waste and the abundance culture of banquets and buffets to be coordinated with food banks and charities. The deputy asked if legislation is expected to encourage or oblige the separation of organic waste
Food waste in Macau is a problem for which Pereira Coutinho would like to see an integrated combat strategy. In a written interplies released yesterday, the deputy highlights the gap between the culture of abundance of social events and the operational difficulties in the collection of food surpluses for distribution to needy families and solidarity institutions. This culture, banquets, buffets and celebrations, “associated with commercial practices that oversee productions, generates critical volumes of surpluses, especially prepared breads, cakes and meals, aggravating the inefficiency of the food chain”, denounces the deputy. To solve food waste in the commercial sector, Pereira Coutinho asks the government if he intends to introduce “standards that encourage or oblige supermarkets, restaurants and other food companies to donate food surpluses still suitable for consumption to social solidarity institutions”. The deputy cites examples of laws in force in Portugal and France, which could be followed by the executive. In addition, it asks if it is possible to implement measures, such as tax incentives, logistical support, simplification of procedures or certification programs, to “facilitate the creation of systematic partnerships between commercial food establishments (supermarkets, restaurants, bakeries, hotels and others) and private entities such as food banks or charities”. So what about the environment? Putting the issue of food waste from the perspective of the popular concept of sustainability, Pereira Coutinho points out not only ethical challenges and their social and economic implications, but also environmental. Firstly, it is urgent to sensitize the population to the need to reduce food waste. The deputy then emphasizes the need to correct the “critical infrastructural disabilities in the management of organic waste, manifested in the absence of industrial composting centers and intelligent logistics networks to donate surpluses in time”. Also the ecological consequences, with greenhouse gas emissions, decomposition in landfills and incinerators, should be addressed. As such, Coutinho asks if the government considers it to create a legal framework that “encourages or obliges the separation of organic waste, namely eating waste, origin (domestic, commercial and institutional)”. The objective is to give proper treatment to waste, such as composting or anaerobic digestion, rather than the use of the landfill.

item.title: Silent angels
item.description: Last July 10, the Hong Kong TVB news reported that in Australia, Melbourne and Sydney, the courts started to have dogs to support the victims while witnessing in court. Labradors and Golden Retriever are preferred dogs for this function. They are sweet and can support the victims. It takes two years to train a “court dog” and costs approximately 150,000 hkd, a value similar to the training of a guide dog. Victims are usually women and children. They are mostly witness to the Family Court in domestic violence processes and are subject to great emotional tension. The monitoring of court dogs allows victims to relax, that interrogation time is reduced and the process to be facilitated. Tribunal dogs are trained by Guide Association, the training is paid by the Law Society, Australia, and are accommodated on the court's premises. Scientific research shows that dog monitoring can reduce the secretion of tension hormones, make thinking clearer and reduce stress more effectively. From a legal point of view, they have the advantage of not talking and cannot affect the witness of the victims. This measure is easily accepted by the accusation and defense. Australia is not the first country to appeal to court dogs. Already in 2021, Japan used them. There are currently four court dogs in Japan and are mainly used to accompany children while their testimonies are recorded. In an old case of children's abuse, a girl refused to go to court. Later, he bravely confronted the aggressor in public, accompanied by one of these "silent angels." This was the first time in Japan where a dog attended a trial. This is why these dogs are called “silent angels.” According to Japanese official data, 160,000 cases of child abuse were reported in 2019. If the number of court dogs will be increased to deal more effectively with these cases. In addition to Australia and Japan, court dogs are also used in the United Kingdom, the United States, France, Canada and Chile. There are currently 240 tax dogs in the United States, divided by 35 states. The law gives all equal rights. The Court uses standard procedures to hear the testimonies of the victims, the defendants and the witnesses of each case. Regardless of the equal rights of the complaint and the defendant, and the standardization of the court's procedures, each case presents its own difficulties. When the victim witness is emotionally disturbed and the details and the accuracy of the testimony are questionable. So, how can the court accept the testimony? How can vague testimony help but in the defendant's acquittal? The presence of court dogs to stabilize the emotions of the victims is important so that they can boldly report the facts and allow a fair judgment to be allowed. This measure reduces the suffering of those who revive a painful experience and manifest empathy with the victims. No wonder it is called the “silent angels” tax dogs. It is certainly appropriate to give good use to the special qualities of dogs for the benefit of humans. From these successful experiences, Hong Kong and Macao courts may consider implementing measures to improve the effectiveness of their procedures. In addition, there may be the need to adapt the court's premises to put, for example, dog bathrooms. Questions such as this should be considered before the use of court dogs is used. The measures needed to introduce tax dogs remind us many others that were previously implemented in the Hong Kong courts to help with the trials. For example, in the case of Donald Tsang, the former head of the Raehk executive, the case was broadcast live on television to allow it to be seen by all. Another example is the testimony of the victims of sexual abuse hidden by a screen; or of witnesses that are questioned by video called. None of these measures have to do with the law of the law, but have improved the effectiveness of judgment and are the demonstration that the feeling of the victims is taken into consideration. The implementation of measures aimed at the protection of the victims must be considered, either in the system of consummented law or in the civil law system. Finally, in addition to the use of court dogs, society should take steps to reduce cases of abuse, violation and violence against women and children. This is the correct approach to attacking the root of the problem and building a peaceful and friendly society. item.title: Valia immigrants
item.description: In any city in the country we go to or faced a hotel, restaurant, hypermarket, construction work, home support, hospital, commercial store, factory, vintage, olive or other fruits harvest, we find immigrants from Angola, Guinea-Bissau, Sao Tome, Brazil, Cape Verde, Nepal or Bangladesh. All speaking Portuguese, integrated in the great need that Portugal has a lack of labor and to contribute to the support of social security. It is with great satisfaction that we are served in a good restaurant where employees, dressed in rigor, extreme education and exemplary kindness convey to us that they are from Angola, Guinea-Bissau or Brazil. They are human beings like the Portuguese who opted for Spain, France, Germany, Finland, the US, Australia, Canada or Timor-Leste. Portuguese who were learning the local language, integrating in society and, essentially, received with the social benefits in force in these countries. In Portugal, we have not yet received immigrants with the dignity they deserved. Most still have to lease a room or a house or, once integrated, assume a bank credit to purchase a property. Some already working immigrants who discount social security are still dominated by the impossibility of living with dignity because they await the title of residence, fall into the hands of the mafias that sell a tent on the outskirts of big cities. Often, there are mayors who before building social housing are embarked on the demolition of tents, leaving these families without ceiling and sleeping in the open, in a gesture of great cruelty and misunderstanding. Of course, immigrants who move to Portugal with a tour visa and then get here illegally and living 20 in a room, they cannot think of acquiring the status of residents. They live in the penance, exploited by the own compatriots and illegal before the Portuguese law. In this regard, the government is taking regulation measures for the entry of immigrants. However, this regulation cannot be radical as André Ventura argues, who, in turn, only wants not to enter Portugal or a neo -fascist's will and will even be expelled all immigrants. Ventura has claimed that crime in Portugal is due to the presence of immigrants. Nothing more wrong. The theory that immigration is responsible for increasing crime, that the latest vacancy of immigration, whatever their nationality, is less desirable than the previous ones, that all newcomers must be faced with an attitude of suspicion is an almost old theory as the English-created colonies on the coast of New England. Recently, the director of the Judicial Police cited figures regarding violent crime, which has been decreased for 20 years and the fact that the ratio of prisoners have evolved in the opposite reason for the increase of the immigrant population. The same kind of evolution happened to those detained by the police that Luís Neves directs. Thus, if in 2009, when the resident foreign population totaled less than half a million (454 191), the PJ detained 631 foreigners (corresponding to 138.9 detained per 100,000 immigrants), in 2023, with the number of more than duplicate resident foreigners (1 044 605), there were 513 detainees, corresponding to 49.1 per 100,000 residents. To substantiate his statements, the PJ director explained more: not only this reduction in the ratio of foreign detainees compared to the number of non -Portuguese residents has been consistent in the last 14 years, but a considerable part of foreign detainees and prisoners, especially related to drug trafficking, not immigrants, but elements of what gives the name of “transnational crime” - with the “mules of mules” drug ”. Another demonstrative fact that increased crime is not directly linked to immigrants is the evidence that municipalities have released. Municipalities with the highest weight of immigrants have less crime. Some examples of municipalities where foreign population has a significant impact on the resident population, with data from 2023: Vila do Bispo (where immigrants represent 43.68%of the total population), Odemira (41.8%) and Lisbon (28.7%). If there was a direct relationship between immigration and crime, it would be expected that the increase of resident foreigners would be reflected directly on a climb of crimes registered by police authorities. But nothing more wrong. Municipalities with the highest weight of immigrants have less crime. Regarding Porto, where immigrant crimes have increased by the media, the growing evolution of foreign residents is also not accompanied by an increase in crime, and even a decrease in crime in years of increased immigration. In 2009 a total of 17,383 crimes was recorded, the year in which 8809 foreigners resided there. In 2019, the crimes went down to 15,422 and resident foreigners increased to almost double: 14,558. In 2023, foreigners resident in Porto again doubled - to 35,653 - and the total of crimes registered from 14,552. In Porto, foreigners currently represent 14.3% of the population. Of all this, we can understand that what André Ventura and his party propagate at all times relating the increase of crime with immigrants is just a racist bullshit to match the attitudes of neo -Nazi that have done everything violently against immigrants.

item.title: COP30 - A challenge for Brazil
item.description: The last two conferences of the United Nations Convention in the United Nations Convention on Climate Change took place in 2023 and 2024, respectively in the United Arab Emirates (COP28) and Azerbaijan (COP29), which, as oil producing countries, should not be very interested in energy transition. Now it is up to Brazil to organize CPO30, from November 10 to 25, 2025, in Belém, Pará. This is not the first time this country has been predisposed to organize such a conference. He had already been invited, and accepted the invitation to organize COP25. However, the government headed by Bolsonaro, a convinced negotiation such as his American mentor Donald Trump, "Roi the rope," said it as a said, claiming that the problem of climate change would be just a commercial game. Chile was then tasked with being the new host, but the great disorders that occurred in this country before the scheduled dates, made the conference to Madrid, between December 2 and 13, 2019. It was an opportunity that was lost to project Brazil as one of the leading countries of the fight against climate change. It turns out that Brazil is among the ten largest producers of gross oil and there are those who doubt that the Brazilian government is greatly interested in the energy transition. Undoubtedly, Lula da Silva's governments have taken into consideration, to some extent, the preservation of the Amazon and the well-being of indigenous populations, and have been committed in oil exploration in areas that may affect them. However, the great commercial value of oil makes it often subaltern the fact that fossil fuels are proven to be the main factor in increasing greenhouse gas concentration in the atmosphere and, consequently, global warming. There was even someone1 in Brazil who even said that oil exploration would contribute to funding the energy transition. There is no doubt that COP30 in Belém will contribute to Brazil has an increasingly important role in the context of the problem inherent in climate change. It will be necessary, however, much skill on the part of the Brazilian government to convince the international community about its intentions to the commitment made when the Paris Agreement signed, in which the need to limit global warming up, until the end of the 21st century, to a maximum of 2 ° C, preferably to values less than 1.5 ° C. In this context, the Brazilian official policy seems not to be very coherent, especially since it has already been approved by the House of Representatives and the Senate, the infamous project-Law No. 2159 of 2021, nicknamed “PL of devastation”, because it opens the way to potentially serious ventures to the environment, such as the much discussed “offshore” oil exploration near the Amazon River mouth. This project, also called “equatorial margin”, may, in the face of the risk of oil spill, affect indigenous communities and biodiversity in the vicinity of the exploration zone. In case of such happening, it would not be the first time in Brazil, meeting that, in 2001, a platform operated by Petrobras suffered several explosions, which caused its sinking with about 1,500 tons of gross oil and the death of 11 people. Incidents of this type in ocean facilities where perforation is not rare. Examples can be mentioned recurring strokes in the nineties of the last century in the North Sea on Shell-operated platforms, with serious consequences for the maritime environment. More recently there was a stroke in the Gulf of Mexico in 2010, where the damage of a security valve on a BP platform caused an explosion that caused the death of 8 workers and a stroke of about 780 million liters of oil, causing irreparable damage to maritime fauna. Incidents of this type may also affect ecosystems that mangais are part, causing damage to the transition zones between the coast and the sea, resulting in the destruction of ecosystems and the increase of erosion caused by the associated waves, or not, to storm tides. Aware of these inconvenient potentials, the Brazilian Institute of Environment and Renewable Natural Resources (Ibama), has been denied licenses for oil exploration several times in the vicinity of the mouth of the Amazon River. According to the “PL of devastation”, “special environmental licenses” may occur for projects considered strategic, which, after submission to the entity responsible for licensing and in the absence of response within one year, would automatically be licensed. Considering that Ibama is characterized by staff scarcity, there will be the risk of projects submitted to be approved, after this period. Given that the president can completely or partially veto the project-law, within 15 days after his submission by Congress2, it is now liable for Lula da Silva to take this attitude. There are only a few days to do so, because the deadline will in principle end on August 8. Throughout this process, President Lula da Silva, unlike the minister of the “Environment and Climate Change”, Marina Silva, has shown a certain passivity, which causes some fear about her attitude regarding the promulgation of the decree. According to the most progressive means in Brazil, Lula da Silva should not have been silent after the approval by Congress, but staying firm vetoing the project “PL of devastation” and other potentially disastrous and attentive projects of forests and populations. In case of veto, it needs to be explained by invoking legal or political reasons, such as unconstitutionality or not convenience or opportunity. In the meantime, an international campaign of Avaaz “Brazil: Stop the Devastation Bill” is underway, with about one million supporters. But not everything is in the hands of Lula, as, in case of veto, the project-Law returns to Congress, which may impose the promulgation of the respective law, if the veto is overthrown by the absolute majority of the votes of the deputies and senators. The last word is, therefore, from Congress. However, there is a great expectation of what will be the attitude of Lula da Silva. It is a tremendous challenge about the balance between environmental protection and economic development. item.title: Portugal | Folio Festival returns to Óbidos with two Nobel Program Nobel Program
item.description: The Folio-International Obidos Literary Festival, which will take place between October 9 and 19, will feature in this edition with two Nobel Prizes of the Literature: Belarusian Svetlana Alexievich and South African J. M. Coetzee, the organization announced. In its 10th edition, the festival will bring Óbidos, in the district of Leiria, two laureates with the Nobel Prize for Literature, reinforcing “the international dimension and the growing prestige of the event in the European and worldwide cultural scenario”, said the City Hall, organizer of the event. Belarussian writer and journalist Svetlana Alexievich, winner of the Nobel Prize for Literature in 2015, will participate in the folio on October 11, at a table of authors scheduled for 9 pm. Svetlana Alexievich is the author of five prose books that constitute the literary project “Voices of Utopia”, of which the works “Voices of Chernobyl,“ War has no woman's face ”,“ The End of Soviet Man ”,“ The Last Witnesses ”and“ Zinc Boys ”are part. On October 17, the folly will host John Maxwell Coetzee, a South African writer who received the Nobel Prize in Literature in 2003. J. M. Coetzee is the author of several novels and rehearsals, most of them translated into Portuguese, including “the life and time of Michael K.”, with which he first received the Booker award in 1983 and “ Disgrace ”, which earned him the same prize in 1999.“ Waiting for the barbarians ”,“ The Island ”and“ The Iron Age ”are other works of the writer. “Your folio intervention will be one of the highlights of this edition and a unique contact opportunity with a central figure of contemporary literary thinking,” says the festival organization. In addition to the two Laureates with the Nobel Prize in Literature, they are confirmed in the 2025 authors such as American journalist Anne Applebaum, Israeli historian Avi Shlaim, Irish writer Paul Murray and American Carmen Maria Machado. For reflection The 2025 edition of the festival has as its theme “Borders” and, according to the House, the program, which should be presented in the coming weeks, “proposes a critical and plural reflection on the geographical, political, linguistic, identity”. The festival will feature roundtables, conversations with authors, reading sessions, concerts, exhibitions, performances, book launches, school public initiatives, children's programming and various network actions with schools, universities, libraries and bookstores. Organized by the Municipality of Óbidos, in partnership with the Municipal Company Óbidos Criativa, Read slowly and the Inatel Foundation, the folio had its first edition in 2015, only interrupted in 2020 due to the Covid-19 pandemic.
